subject: RE: [junit] suppressing test cases from base class in an extended	 class
msgSnippet: Hi Alok, So it sounds to me like you want the fixture of the base class (since you want the setUp and tearDown to run), but you don t want the test methods to
messageBody:
Hi Alok,

So it sounds to me like you want the fixture of the base class (since you
want the setUp and tearDown to run), but you don't want the test methods to
run. If that's correct, then I don't think you really want to extend.
Include method B in your base class, and using the static suite method,
return a suite of the methods you want to run, for now. I think that will
accomplish what you're looking for, unless there was some other reason for
you to want to extend the base test case. It's unclear why you're doing
that.

-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: Alok Daipuria [mailto:alok.daipuria@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 25, 2003 12:43 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] suppressing test cases from base class in an extended
class


I have an existing test case class which I extended to add few more test
cases. When I run the extended test case, it runs the test cases from the
base class as well. Is there a flag or something which I can use to suppress
running test cases present in the base class.
Here's an example of the scenario :

class A extends TestCase
{
public testA() {}
}

class B extends A
{
public testB() {}
}

When I execute class B, it runs both testA() and testB(), which I want to
avoid for now. I need to extend to be able to use the setup/teardown done by
A.

-alok


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
